results.title: [Postmaster General's Department: dead letter office]
results.brief_description: A short documentary about the lives of letters sent to the “dead letter office”. Sends a message out to the people of Victoria to put their name and address on the back of posted envelopes.

results.title: [Port Arlington steam flour mill]
results.brief_description: The Port Arlington steam flour mill was opened in 1857 and closed in 1874. This film was shot during the early stages of the National Trust’s project to reconstruct the mill showing volunteers excavating the boiler house area. The supervising architect and archaeologist take a reporter on a brief tour of the historic building providing an explanation of artifacts uncovered during the excavation; structural and architectural features; a brief history of the mill; and an outline of the restoration project.

results.title: [Polly Woodside mast]
results.brief_description: This short film shows the activity of the National Trust of Australia’s members associated with the placing of the mast on the Polly Woodside ship which the Trust is restoring as a historical article worthy of preservation.

results.title: [Plum pudding: a collection of 8 short animated films]
results.brief_description: This collection of short animated films directed by eight film students at the Newton Creative Arts Center shows a diverse range of issues that are laced to motivate and for showing students’ achievements. This creative media allows a mixture of students to experiment with film and animation.

results.title: [Pictures of France: Savoi]
results.brief_description: Celebrated glaciers, lakes, forests and mountains including Mont Blanc provide scenic grandeur in the province of Savoi. Steamers take visitors to the spa, on Lake Geneva to drink the water and enjoy the varied sports. Wonderful views and winter sports are enjoyed by mountain-climbers and visitors, especially on the teleferry and ski-tows.

results.title: [Pickles]
results.brief_description: Animated vignettes capturing the absurdity of various human predicaments, clarifying some truths that are not self-evident. 1. War—2. I omnipotence—3. Religion—4. Democracy—5. Advertising—6. Drugs—7. Television—8. Hunger—9. Conquests—10. Defilement—11. Life—12. Conclusion. Script, animation and direction by Bruno Bozzetto; special collaboration by Ugo Magni; editing by Giancarlo Rossi.
